page.title: 07Employment in Sth Benfleet.
page.content: Until the coming of the railway in 1856 Benfleet was an agricultural, rural community.Occupations were based on farming and fishing.Traditional occupations remain:sails are made,and so is tarpaulin.Many small clothing factories supply the 'rag trade'of London.To the north of Thundersley is a large purpose-built trading estate.Here are light engineering works and warehouses.A major employer Standard Telephones and Cables is due to close during 1986,but unemployment is fairly low.Few of the Benfleet residents work here.London and Southend provide office jobs. Others work in Basildon New Town and its associated industrial estates, especially the Ford Tractor Plant. Tilbury Docks and associated industry are another source of employment.Many people use their cars to go to work.
